By Matt Law, European Football Editor
Filed: Thursday, March 15, 2018 at 15:12 UK
Updated: Thursday, March 15, 2018 at 15:12 UK

England boss Gareth Southgate has said that Danny Welbeck's ability to "run in behind" has seen him earn a spot in the Three Lions squad for the upcoming friendlies with Netherlands and Italy.

The 27-year-old has netted 15 times in 36 caps for England, however, and Southgate has revealed that Welbeck is a direct replacement for Harry Kane, who is on the sidelines with an ankle problem.
Real Betis believe Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere encouraged their interest in him as part of a strategy to get a good deal in new contract negotiations with the Gunners.
